Field Detail

serialVersionUID

private static final long serialVersionUID
See Also:
Constant Field Values

userid

private String userid
This user's userid. This is used to figure out which server to connect to, as well as to authenticate with that server.

serverRsaPub

private BigInteger serverRsaPub
The public security key of this user's realm server.

serverRsaMod

private BigInteger serverRsaMod
The security key modulus of this user's realm server.

computer

private String computer
The name of this computer that the user has chosen. This is used when authenticating with the server.

rsaEncPub

private BigInteger rsaEncPub
This, along with the other rsa fields, contain the user's security keys. These are stored in the public-rsa-enc-pub, public-rsa-enc-mod, public-rsa-sig-pub, and public-rsa-sig-mod user properties. the private keys are not stored on the server.

rsaEncPrv

private BigInteger rsaEncPrv

rasEncMod

private BigInteger rasEncMod

rsaSigPub

private BigInteger rsaSigPub

rsaSigPrv

private BigInteger rsaSigPrv

rsaSigMod

private BigInteger rsaSigMod

passwordHint

private String passwordHint
The user's password hint. The user can set this up in their settings dialog, and it is usually synchronized between computers.

encPassword

private String encPassword
The user's encrypted password, in the format returned by Hash.hash(String). This is used to authenticate the user.

autoSignOn

private boolean autoSignOn
True if the user should be automatically logged on when OpenGroove starts. storedPassword must not be null if this is true. The hashed value of storedPassword should also match encPassword if this is true.

isSearchVisible

private boolean isSearchVisible
True if this user has chosen to be publicly visible. This directly corresponds to CommandCommunicator.getVisibility().

isLocalVisible

private boolean isLocalVisible
True if this user has chosen to be locally visible. If this is true, then the user will respond to multicast queries for users on the same network.

realName

private String realName
This user's real name. This is made visible in the public-real-name user property.

emailAddress

private String emailAddress
This user's private email address. This is the email address that operators of this user's realm server, or OpenGroove administrators themselves, will use to contact this user. This must not be null or the empty string. This is made visible in the email-address user property.

publicEmailAddress

private String publicEmailAddress
This user's public email address. This is the email address that others will see as this user's email address. This can be null or the empty string, which usually indicates that this user doesn't want to reveal any email information to other users. This is made visible in the public-email-address user property.

lag

private long lag
This user's time lag as compared with the server. This is equal to myTime - serverTime, where myTime is the value of System.currentTimeMillis() invoked on this computer, and serverTime is the value of System.currentTimeMillis() invoked on the server. The server's time can then be reconstructed by evaluating myTime - lag. This allows for time-sensitive operations to be ordered correctly, even if multiple users don't have the same system time on their computers.

This is not synchronized between the user's computers, as it is usually different for all of them.

storedPassword

private String storedPassword
If this is not null, then this is the plain-text value of the user's password, and the user won't be prompted for their password when they want to sign on.

isLoggedIn

public boolean isLoggedIn()
Returns true if the user is logged in on this computer.

Returns:

getContext

public UserContext getContext()
Returns the user context for this user, if they are logged in. If not, null is returned. This method is a shortcut for OpenGroove.userContextMap.get(getUserid()).

Returns:
